commit.message: fix(examples/pulumi/gitlab): adjust path traversal to get to the example role

Update first-party Pulumi dependencies to v3.144.1 (#355)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
|
[github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pkg/v3](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi)
| require | minor | `v3.127.0` -> `v3.144.1` |
|
[github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi)
| require | minor | `v3.127.0` -> `v3.144.1` |

---

<summary>pulumi/pulumi (github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pkg/v3)</summary>

- \[cli/plugin] Log plugin unstructured output to debug instead of info
[#​17943](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/17943)

-   \[sdk/yaml] Update pulumi-yaml to 1.13.0
[#​18077](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18077)

##### Bug Fixes

-   \[backend/diy] Retry deletes of lock files if they fail
[#​18059](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18059)

- \[engine] Use package load v2 in loader server so it can include

[#​18072](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18072)
[#​18021](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18021)

- \[programgen/dotnet] Emit local dependencies in restore sources
deterministically
[#​18026](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18026)

- \[sdk/go] Ignore DependsOn for direct form invokes instead of raising
an error
[#​18089](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18089)

-   \[sdk/nodejs] Respect the noCheck option from tsconfig.json
[#​18067](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18067)

-   \[sdk/nodejs] Gracefully handle errors that don't implement toString
[#​18080](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18080)

-   \[sdk/python] Fix hang on error when using uv on Windows
[#​18054](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18054)

- \[sdkgen/dotnet] Compute restore sources from local dependencies and

[#​18042](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18042)

##### Miscellaneous

-   \[sdkgen/go] Skip TestPackageAddGoParameterized
[#​18049](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/18049)

#### What's Changed

- Upgrade tests with known source edits by
[@​VenelinMartinov](https://redirect.github.com/VenelinMartinov)
in
[https://github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/95](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/95)

[@​danielrbradley](https://redirect.github.com/danielrbradley) in
[https://github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/101](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/101)
- Fix various warnings by
[@​danielrbradley](https://redirect.github.com/danielrbradley) in
[https://github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/103](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/103)
- Pass `T` explicitly to all methods by
[@​danielrbradley](https://redirect.github.com/danielrbradley) in
[https://github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/102](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/102)

####  Breaking change 

You must now pass T as the first parameter for any method which does
asserts internally, as is the pattern in Go.

You can fix pretty much all usages using the following batch of `gofmt`
commands:

```bash
gofmt -r 'a.Convert(b) -> a.Convert(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.CopyTo(b) -> a.CopyTo(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.CopyToTempDir() -> a.CopyToTempDir(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Destroy() -> a.Destroy(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.ExportStack() -> a.ExportStack(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.GrpcLog() -> a.GrpcLog(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.ClearGrpcLog() -> a.ClearGrpcLog(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d, e, f, g) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d, e, f, g)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d, e, f) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d, e, f)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d, e) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d, e)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c) -> a.Import(t, b, c)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b) -> a.Import(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.ImportStack(b) -> a.ImportStack(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Install() -> a.Install(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.InstallStack(b) -> a.InstallStack(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Preview() -> a.Preview(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Refresh() -> a.Refresh(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.SetConfig(b, c) -> a.SetConfig(t, b, c)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Up() -> a.Up(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.UpdateSource(b) -> a.UpdateSource(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.NewStack(b) -> a.NewStack(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Run(b) -> a.Run(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
```

Co-authored-by: pulumi-renovate[bot] <189166143+pulumi-renovate[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Bryce Lampe <bryce@pulumi.com>

Fix schema path elem traversal (#1757)

Fixes https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-gcp/issues/1794

This is the second attempt at fixing
https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-gcp/issues/1794, so strict scrutiny
would be appreciated.

The core of the issue is correctly interpreting this block:


https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-terraform-bridge/blob/07b2c1c9587009bc89eb554bddcd8e7bf72e2668/pkg/tfshim/shim.go#L102-L127

From what I can tell, both `propertyPathToSchemaPathInner` and
`schemaPathToPropertyPathInner` confuse case 3 for case 2:

`propertyPathToSchemaPathInner` and `schemaPathToPropertyPathInner`
correctly handle case 2 (`(schema, ps) ~ {x: T}`), traversing
`(schema.Elem().(shim.Resource).Schema(), ps.Fields)`. This is correct,
as the `.Elem()` in the `shim` path is a fiction of representation.
`ps.Fields` correctly represents that `(schema, ps)` is the object (`{x:
T}`) in question.

Currently, both functions incorrectly handle case 3 (`(schema, ps) ~
List[{x: T}], (schema.Elem(), ps.Elem) ~ {x: T}`), treating it
identically to case 2. The correct traversal for the nested object is
`(schema.Elem().(shim.Resource).Schema(), ps.Elem.Fields)` (note the
additional `.Elem` after `ps`). This PR makes that change, and adds a
test case to lock it in.

[https://github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/103](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/103)
- Pass `T` explicitly to all methods by
[@​danielrbradley](https://redirect.github.com/danielrbradley) in
[https://github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/102](https://redirect.github.com/pulumi/providertest/pull/102)

####  Breaking change 

You must now pass T as the first parameter for any method which does
asserts internally, as is the pattern in Go.

You can fix pretty much all usages using the following batch of `gofmt`
commands:

```bash
gofmt -r 'a.Convert(b) -> a.Convert(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.CopyTo(b) -> a.CopyTo(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.CopyToTempDir() -> a.CopyToTempDir(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Destroy() -> a.Destroy(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.ExportStack() -> a.ExportStack(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.GrpcLog() -> a.GrpcLog(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.ClearGrpcLog() -> a.ClearGrpcLog(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d, e, f, g) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d, e, f, g)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d, e, f) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d, e, f)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d, e) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d, e)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c, d) -> a.Import(t, b, c, d)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b, c) -> a.Import(t, b, c)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Import(b) -> a.Import(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.ImportStack(b) -> a.ImportStack(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Install() -> a.Install(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.InstallStack(b) -> a.InstallStack(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Preview() -> a.Preview(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Refresh() -> a.Refresh(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.SetConfig(b, c) -> a.SetConfig(t, b, c)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Up() -> a.Up(t)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.UpdateSource(b) -> a.UpdateSource(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.NewStack(b) -> a.NewStack(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
gofmt -r 'a.Run(b) -> a.Run(t, b)' -w ./**/*_test.go
```

Efficient schema traversal (#1590)

The goal is a general solution that abstracts traversing each SchemaInfo
in a provider and applying some action. To prevent the provider from
bogging down during startup, the API needs to do a full search during
tfgen time, and then visit only impactful fields during the providers
runtime.

This implementation will replace gcp's labels traversal, aws's tags
traversal and will be used in akamai to unify types.

The implementation takes after
https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-terraform-bridge/pull/1544. Visitors
return if they had an "effect". During `make tfgen`, every path is
visited and a list of "effectful" `SchemaPath`s is built. During the
provider's normal runtime, this list is deserialized and only these
paths are visited.

repository.description: A library allowing Terraform providers to be bridged into Pulumi.

commit.message:
Move .version to /sdk and embed it (#15185)

<!--- 
Thanks so much for your contribution! If this is your first time
contributing, please ensure that you have read the
[CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
documentation.
-->

# Description

go:embed can not traverse paths upwards, move .version so we can embed
it. This enables us to have the version available outside of binary
builds (where we use linker flags to embed the version in
sdk/go/common/version/version.go).

This is useful for automation API, where we want to have the current
version available to us, but don't want to force consumers of the API to
build and test with linker flags.

Blocking for https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/15049

commit.message:
Mark createOnlyProperties with replaceOnChange (#1053)

Updated gen to add the `repalceOnChanges` flag to any properties
identified in the CF schema as `createOnlyProperties`.

Fixes #736 (mostly; we'll still need to address
https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-java/issues/1189 to get the correct
behavior in java)

## Details

I've implemented this as a post-processing step on the Resource spec to
avoid cluttering the already complicated type generation and naming
logic.

Ironically, while both the aws CF schema and the sdks use a list of path
strings on the root of the resource to designate
createOnlyProperties/replaceOnChanges, the schema layer uses a flag on
the leaf propertySpecs. So we have to traverse the structure when
setting replaceOnChanges, and then the sdk generation process has to
traverse it again to rebuild the paths.


## Testing
I've added new unit tests and manually verified the schema changes.

Fix asset bugs; write more tests

This change fixes a couple bugs with assets:

* We weren't recursing into subdirectories in the new "path as
  archive" feature, which meant we missed most of the files.

* We need to make paths relative to the root of the archive
  directory itself, otherwise paths end up redundantly including
  the asset's root folder path.

* We need to clean the file paths before adding them to the
  archive asset map, otherwise they are inconsistent between the
  path, tar, tgz, and zip cases.

* Ignore directories when traversing zips, since they aren't
  included in the other formats.

* Tolerate io.EOF errors when reading the ZIP contents into blobs.

* Add test cases for the four different archive kinds.

This fixes pulumi/pulumi-aws#50.

Fix asset bugs; write more tests

This change fixes a couple bugs with assets:

* We weren't recursing into subdirectories in the new "path as
  archive" feature, which meant we missed most of the files.

* We need to make paths relative to the root of the archive
  directory itself, otherwise paths end up redundantly including
  the asset's root folder path.

* We need to clean the file paths before adding them to the
  archive asset map, otherwise they are inconsistent between the

Completely overengineering everything (#2919)

* Set the packagemanager option since the custom init doesn't

* Use the new app init command

* Add init test suite

* Fix some stuff but find more problems

# Conflicts:
#	pkg/thecluster/app/init.go

* Refactor init function and related tests

Significant changes include:
- Removed unnecessary import from the init.go file
- Renamed 'relativePath' to 'appPath' for better clarity
- Simplified error handling in the Init function
- Removed context dependency from Root and PathTo functions in path.go, leading to changes in their respective test cases as well.
- Fixed a typo in an error message in path.go

* Added new dependency and removed two indirect ones

In this update, a new package 'unstoppablemango/tdl/pkg' has been added to the project dependencies. Additionally, two indirect dependencies 'davecgh/go-spew' and 'stretchr/objx' have been removed from the list of required packages.

* Add Template and TemplateGroup interfaces

Introduced two new interfaces, Template and TemplateGroup, in the 'thecluster' package. The Template interface is empty for now while the TemplateGroup interface includes methods to get name and sequence of templates.

* Introduced template discovery functionality

Added new files to handle template discovery in the application. This includes a walker struct and associated methods for traversing file systems, as well as functions for determining relative paths and handling errors. The changes also include placeholder function for future implementation of templates within workspace.

* Added sequence operations in new file

Introduced a new file with sequence operations for three generic types. The operations include FilterR, Filter, Map3, and Reduce3. These functions allow for filtering sequences based on a predicate, mapping sequences to different values, and reducing sequences to a single value respectively.

* Added testing suite and updated import formatting

In this update, a new testing suite has been added to the 'iter' package. This includes tests for the Seq3 function. Additionally, the import statement in seq3.go has been reformatted for better readability.

* More seq3 tests

* Renaming things

* Even more seqs

* Add an fs iterator

* Fs iterator tests

* Buncha functional crap

* Added sequence utilities for iteration

Introduced new utility functions in the 'seq' package to enhance iteration capabilities. These include an 'Empty' function for creating empty sequences, an 'Append' function for adding elements to a sequence, and 'FilterR', 'Filter', and 'Map' functions for transforming sequences. The changes aim to provide more flexibility when working with sequences of any type.

* Refactor sequence operations and add new file system utilities

Significant changes include:
- Removed FilterR, Filter, and Map functions from the internal/iter package. These were generic sequence operations that have been deemed unnecessary.
- Added two new files to the pkg/fs package: export.go and reducer.go.
  - In export.go, a type alias for fs.FileInfo was created.
  - In reducer.go, several types and functions related to filesystem iteration and reduction were introduced. This includes Cursor interface, cursor struct with its methods, Reducer type alias, Accumulate type alias, NewReducer function and Reduce function.

* Updated import path for 'iter' package

The import statement for the 'iter' package has been updated to use its full GitHub path. This change ensures that the correct version of the 'iter' package is used, improving reliability and maintainability.

* Refactored template discovery logic

Significant changes include:
- Removed unused imports and added new ones
- Replaced 'Templates' struct with 'group' struct, adding new fields and methods
- Refactored the 'walker' type to include a new method 'Iter'
- Updated the Discover function to return an iterator of group results instead of Templates
- Adjusted corresponding test case in discover_test.go to reflect these changes

* Refactor import paths and enhance sequence functionality

The import path in the empty.go file has been updated to a more specific one. In f.go, the Append function now uses a reference instead of directly using the value. A new Singleton function has also been added to create a sequence with a single element.

Two new test files, f_test.go and seq_suite_test.go, have been created for testing purposes. The tests cover scenarios such as appending an item to an empty or non-empty sequence.

* Refactored function names and improved directory handling

Renamed functions in seq.go for brevity. Enhanced the 'Iter' function in discover.go to handle directories more efficiently, including relative path calculation. Updated corresponding tests in discover_test.go to reflect these changes and added new test cases for local pulumi templates discovery.

* Updated test initialization and imports

The import order has been rearranged for better readability. Also, the "should initialize an app" test case has been marked as pending. This means it won't be executed until the Pending status is removed.

* Added FS type alias to fs package

In addition to the existing FileInfo type alias, a new type alias for FS has been introduced in the fs package. This change enhances code readability and consistency across the project.

* Refactor app initialization and workspace editing

Significant changes include:
- Removed context from the app initialization function
- Changed 'Writable' to 'Edit' in workspace handling, improving clarity
- Added a new test for typescript template discovery
- Refactored writable struct in workspace handling, separating base, layer and projection into individual methods
- Introduced Writer type and Write function to handle multiple writers in workspace editing.

* Altogether way too much to group templates
